definitions: To alleviate or remove pain, distress, or a burden.
To release someone from a duty or responsibility.
To make a situation less serious or monotonous.
To provide aid or assistance to someone in need.
To replace someone who is on duty.
examples: The medication will relieve your headache.
She was relieved of her duties.
A joke can relieve the tension.
They sent supplies to relieve the famine victims.
Another guard will relieve him at midnight.
